column5: I had a $50 gift card for BPS so I figured today would be a good time to go up and spend it, but by the time I completed the 80 KM round trip, I felt like I'd been driving in a demolition derby with some of the morons I had to share the hiway with.  Like most places, it snowed here (Toronto) all night and when I left home this morning at 9:30 we'd had about 6" of snow and the DVP/401/400 were basically covered with snow & slush, and most folks were driving accordingly, but as always, there were the usual assortment of hotshots on the road that thought their driving skills were far superior to everyone else and found no need to go slower than about 120 KPH and when they hit the slippery & slush covered spots and crashed, they naturally took several other cars with them, and I passed no less the 7 multi vehicle accidents along my route.  I never actually witnessed any of them, but I'm darned sure every one of those 7 crashes was caused by some guy who was driving waaaaaaay too fast for the conditions and when he lost control, he took some innocent folks with him everytime . It was unbelievable how fast some of those guys were driving considering the poor condition of the roads, and I just hope none of the innocent people they took out are seriously hurt.  C'mon guys, when the roads are covered in snow, slush & ice, please slow down a bit and drive accordingly, cause the life you save may be mine or my family....thanks.  And BTW, this thread IS fishing related cause I bought 2 nice musky bucks for my $50

Good or bad weather conditions he drive the same speed and curses the slow pokes. He's probably one of those guys on the 401 you see flying by at 120 regaurdless of condions.
